channel.title: [PI]Veng GFX
channel.description:
[b]Server Base:[/b] Project Insanity [b]Problem:[/b] Veng GFX [b]Details:[/b] The vengeance emote works perfectly, but the gfx is wrong. Instead of a red skull appearing, a weird line appears in the middle of my body. Here is my emote and gfx code as well as a picture.
[code] c.startAnimation(4410); c.gfx100(657);[/code]
[img]http://img692.imageshack.us/img692/6266/vengwrong.png[/img]

item.title: [PI]Veng GFX
item.dc:creator: @Football1smylife Football1smylife
item.description:
@Football1smylife wrote:

Nevermind, fixed it myself. My GFX was 726

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Veng GFX
item.dc:creator: @Football1smylife Football1smylife
item.description:
@Football1smylife wrote:

Nice find, but unfortunately there is no //c.gfx100(604); in my PlayerAssistant class. I did the ::gfx 604 in-game and it already has a gfx as well.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Veng GFX
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

go to playerassistant class and find

//c.gfx100(604);
remove the // Now save and compile

now go into your spotanim.java (Client sided)
search for ur vengeance method and replace

if(j == 604){//Red skull cache[j].anInt405 = 1500; cache[j].anInt406 = 4417; cache[j].aAnimation_407 = Animation.anims[cache[j].anInt406]; }
with this :
if(j == 604){//Red skull cache[j].anInt405 = 12411; cache[j].anInt406 = 4417; cache[j].aAnimation_407 = Animation.anims[cache[j].anInt406]; }
now add the model in you raw folder

http://uppit.com/r2i3oskt50tl/12411.dat

NOTE: none of this is my work it came from r-locus.

Read full topic
